SupportFAQ.supportSubtitle: Find answers to common questions or get in touch with our support team
SupportFAQ.faqShippingAnswer: Standard shipping typically takes 3-7 business days. Express shipping is available for faster delivery within 1-2 business days.
SupportFAQ.faqReturnAnswer: You can return items within 30 days of purchase. Items must be in original condition with tags attached. Free returns are available for defective items.
SupportFAQ.faqPaymentQuestion: What payment methods do you accept?
SupportFAQ.faqPaymentAnswer: We accept all major credit cards, PayPal, Apple Pay, Google Pay, and bank transfers. All payments are securely processed.
SupportFAQ.faqAccountQuestion: How do I create an account?
SupportFAQ.faqAccountAnswer: Click on 'Sign Up' and provide your email address, create a password, and verify your email. You can also sign up using your social media accounts.
SupportFAQ.faqOrderQuestion: How can I track my order?
SupportFAQ.faqOrderAnswer: Once your order ships, you'll receive a tracking number via email. You can also track your order in the 'My Orders' section of your account.
SupportFAQ.faqRefundAnswer: Refunds are processed within 3-5 business days after we receive your return. The refund will appear on your original payment method.
SupportFAQ.faqSellerQuestion: How do I become a seller?
SupportFAQ.faqSellerAnswer: To become a seller, go to your profile and click 'Become a Seller'. You'll need to provide business information and verify your identity.
SupportFAQ.faqSafetyAnswer: Yes, we use industry-standard encryption and security measures to protect your personal and payment information. We never share your data with third parties.
SupportFAQ.stillNeedHelpDescription: Can't find what you're looking for? Our support team is here to help you.
SupportFAQ.emailSupportMessage: Our support team will get back to you within 24 hours.
SupportFAQ.liveChatMessage: Live chat is available Monday-Friday, 9 AM - 6 PM.
SupportFAQ.descriptionPlaceholder: Please describe your issue or question in detail...
SupportFAQ.descriptionTooShort: Description must be at least 20 characters
SupportFAQ.submitError: An error occurred while submitting your request. Please try again.
SupportFAQ.submitSuccess: Your support request has been submitted successfully. We will get back to you soon.

footer.tagline: Your trusted marketplace for quality products and amazing deals
footer.allRightsReserved: All rights reserved. Nar24 is a product of E.C.T.S TRADING LTD

cookieConsent.title: We Value Your Privacy
cookieConsent.description: We use cookies to enhance your browsing experience, serve personalized content, and analyze our traffic. By clicking 'Accept All', you consent to our use of cookies.
cookieConsent.necessaryDesc: Essential for the website to function. These cookies enable core functionality such as security, authentication, and network management.
cookieConsent.functionalDesc: Enable enhanced functionality and personalization, such as language preferences and theme settings.
cookieConsent.analyticsDesc: Help us understand how visitors interact with our website by collecting and reporting anonymous information.
cookieConsent.marketingDesc: Used to track visitors across websites to display relevant advertisements and encourage user engagement.

termsAndConditions.title: Terms and Conditions
termsAndConditions.introduction: By accessing or using this website, you agree to be bound by these Terms and Conditions. Please read them carefully before using our services.
termsAndConditions.footerNote: By continuing to use Nar24, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agreed to these Terms and Conditions.

general.title: General Provisions
content: Accessing this website or using any information on this website means you accept the following conditions.

E.C.T.S TRADING LTD is not responsible for any direct or indirect damages that may arise from entering this website, using the site or information and other data, programs, etc., due to breach of contract, tort, or other reasons.
E.C.T.S TRADING LTD accepts no responsibility for interruption of transactions, errors, negligence, interruptions resulting from breach of contract, tort, negligence or other reasons.

E.C.T.S TRADING LTD reserves the right to change all types of services, products, terms of use of the site and information presented on the site without prior notice, reorganize the site, and stop publication. Changes take effect at the time of publication on the site.
E.C.T.S TRADING LTD is not responsible for the content of other websites that are linked or referenced, which are not under its control.

userObligations.title: User Obligations
content: The User declares and undertakes that they have read, fully understood, and unconditionally accepted all the provisions of this agreement and all matters on the website.

The User cannot use the service provided by E.C.T.S on the site in any way that disrupts public order, is contrary to general morality, harasses and disturbs others, is for an illegal purpose, or infringes on the intellectual or industrial rights of others.
The User cannot give the password provided by E.C.T.S or determined by themselves to other persons or organizations. Usage rights are personal and cannot be transferred.
The User is responsible for ensuring the security of their username and password, taking necessary precautions, and not sharing passwords with others.
The User agrees not to access or use other users' software, personal data, or other information without permission.
The User agrees not to distribute messages containing legally prohibited information, harmful software such as viruses, worms, or any other content that could harm third parties.

platformRights.title: Platform Rights and Authorities
content: E.C.T.S has the right to unilaterally suspend the service permanently or temporarily, postpone, limit, or terminate user access to any page or service without stating a reason and without warning.
E.C.T.S has the right to terminate or suspend memberships of users who provide incomplete or incorrect information or act contrary to the terms of use, without any explanation.
E.C.T.S does not guarantee that the services provided on the website will be uninterrupted or error-free.
E.C.T.S has the right to reject, delay, publish late, not publish, or remove any content, email, or message from users without showing a reason.
The right to advertise and promote on the E.C.T.S site belongs only to E.C.T.S or third parties authorized by E.C.T.S.
E.C.T.S is not responsible for technical errors causing price, product, and all kinds of update errors and can update and change prices on the site at any time.

privacy.title: Privacy and Personal Data Processing
content: To provide you with better service and understand your needs and interests, E.C.T.S collects, transmits, and uses personal information by making appropriate notifications and obtaining consent.
E.C.T.S may also collect information using Automatic Data Collection Tools such as web signals, cookies, scrambled web links when you visit a site.
Your personal data will be processed for purposes such as taking orders, providing products and services, making payments, contacting you for marketing purposes, and sending newsletters via email.
Personal data will be stored, used, updated, modified, classified, disclosed, shared, transferred domestically and internationally using automatic/non-automatic methods.
E.C.T.S may contact members via SMS/text message, instant notification, automatic calling, computer, phone, fax, email, and other electronic communications.
Personal data is stored securely in accordance with Personal Data Protection Law with all administrative and technical security measures taken.

termination.title: Termination and Modifications
content: E.C.T.S and the User can terminate this agreement at any time.
E.C.T.S has the right to make changes, adjustments, and updates unilaterally in the terms of this User Agreement and the services offered on the website at any time.
These changes, adjustments, and updates are considered valid from the moment they are published on the Web.

The User accepts and undertakes to immediately compensate for all damages that E.C.T.S and/or third parties will suffer due to actions contrary to the rights and obligations specified in the agreement.

disputes.title: Dispute Resolution
content: This agreement is subject to the laws of the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus and will be resolved according to these laws.
The courts of the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus shall have jurisdiction.

notifications.title: Notification Addresses
content: The address notified by the User or Member to E.C.T.S is accepted as the legal notification address for all kinds of notifications to be made regarding this agreement.

Unless the User or Member notifies E.C.T.S in writing of changes in their current addresses within 3 (three) days, notifications made to old addresses will be valid and deemed to have been made to them.

All notifications made by E.C.T.S using the member's e-mail address registered in the system are equally valid, and the e-mail will be deemed to have reached the member 1 (one) day after being sent by E.C.T.S.

enforcement.title: Enforcement
content: The User or Member declares, accepts, and undertakes that they have read, understood, accepted all the articles in this agreement, and confirmed the accuracy of the information they provided about themselves.
This agreement is concluded upon the User or member entering the website or becoming a member and has entered into force mutually and indefinitely.
The agreement will automatically become null and void without any need for notice upon termination of membership or the occurrence of any of the termination cases listed in this agreement.

membershipAgreement.title: Membership Agreement
membershipAgreement.introduction: This Membership Agreement establishes the terms and conditions between E.C.T.S TRADING LTD and Members who use our Platform services. By creating an account and using our services, you agree to be bound by this agreement.
membershipAgreement.footerNote: By continuing to use Nar24, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agreed to this Membership Agreement.

parties.title: Parties
content: This Membership Agreement is between E.C.T.S TRADING LTD ('ECTS') and the user ('Member') who registers and uses the Platform.
ECTS operates as an e-marketplace and e-commerce service provider through various mobile applications and websites.
Members agree to this Agreement by registering on the Platform, using the Platform, and/or conducting transactions through the Platform.
This Agreement also covers the relationship between ECTS and Buyers on the website, determining the terms and conditions for services provided.

definitions.title: Definitions
content: Virtual Store: A dedicated section where Sellers can publish listings for multiple products and/or services.
Service/Services: Applications provided by ECTS to enable Members to perform their defined transactions.
User/Users: Natural and legal persons accessing the website.
Platform/Website: The website accessible through the domain name where ECTS provides services.
Member/Members: Users who register on the website and benefit from content, applications and services, including buyers and sellers.
Buyer: A Member who purchases goods and/or services offered for sale by Sellers on the Platform.
Seller: A legal or natural person Member who offers various products and/or services for sale through listings published on their account.

rightsObligations.title: Rights and Obligations of Parties
content: To gain membership status, users must accept this Agreement, provide accurate and complete information, and have their application approved by ECTS.
Members must be at least 18 years old and meet other conditions determined by ECTS and applicable legislation.
Membership accounts are personal and cannot be transferred to third parties. Members must not use other Members' accounts.
ECTS acts as an intermediary service provider and/or hosting provider. ECTS is not responsible for content accuracy except for products sold directly by ECTS.
Members acknowledge that ECTS is not a party to sales contracts between Members and Sellers, except where ECTS is the seller.
Members must comply with this Agreement, Platform rules announced by ECTS, applicable legislation, and ethical standards.
Members are responsible for the security of their user credentials and must take necessary precautions to protect their account information.
ECTS may restrict, block, suspend, or terminate memberships at its sole discretion without stating reasons.
Members can terminate their membership at any time without stating reasons through the Platform.
ECTS may modify, suspend, discontinue, or charge for Platform services at its sole discretion.

dataProtection.title: Personal Data Protection
content: ECTS processes personal data in accordance with applicable data protection legislation to provide services, fulfill orders, and improve Member satisfaction.
Personal data is processed for account security, fraud prevention, dispute resolution, and other purposes specified in this Agreement.
ECTS processes personal data to provide Members with suitable products within the Platform's offerings.
Members consent to their personal data being used for statistical evaluations, advertising, marketing, and commercial communications by ECTS or its partners.
ECTS will take all necessary measures to securely store personal information.
Members have the right to modify their personal information at any time.

commercialMessages.title: Commercial Electronic Messages
content: ECTS may send commercial electronic messages to Members who have given consent via email or SMS for marketing purposes.
Members are responsible for keeping their email addresses and phone numbers accurate and up-to-date.
Members have the right to refuse or withdraw consent for commercial electronic messages through methods specified in applicable legislation or through Platform preferences.

intellectualProperty.title: Intellectual Property Rights
content: All Platform content and elements, including trademarks, copyrights, patents, designs, software, databases, and other materials belong to ECTS.
Content shared by Members through the Platform belongs to the respective Members, subject to the full license granted to ECTS.
Membership does not grant any rights to the Platform, ECTS content, or other Member content.
Members are strictly prohibited from using, copying, reproducing, modifying, reverse engineering, or distributing Platform content outside its intended use.
Members who violate these prohibitions are obligated to compensate ECTS and/or third parties for all damages.

contractModifications.title: Contract Modifications and Waiver
content: ECTS may modify this Agreement and Platform policies at any time by announcement at its sole discretion.
Changes become effective upon publication on the Platform unless otherwise stated by ECTS.
Members are deemed to accept changes by continuing to use the Platform/Services.
Waivers by ECTS are not valid unless signed. Non-exercise of rights does not constitute waiver of those rights.

forceMajeure.title: Force Majeure
content: Force Majeure events include rebellion, embargo, state intervention, war, mobilization, strikes, lockouts, cyber attacks, infrastructure failures, natural disasters, legislation changes, and other events beyond ECTS's control.
ECTS is not liable for obligations prevented or delayed by Force Majeure events.
Force Majeure events do not constitute a breach of this Agreement.

miscellaneous.title: Miscellaneous Provisions
content: Members accept that ECTS's official records, databases, e-archive records, and computer records constitute binding and exclusive evidence in disputes.
This Agreement is governed by the laws of the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus.
Courts of the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus have jurisdiction over disputes arising from this Agreement.
This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties. Invalidity of any provision does not affect remaining provisions.
Members cannot assign rights or obligations under this Agreement without ECTS's prior written consent.
ECTS may assign its rights and obligations to affiliated companies, subsidiaries, or third parties without Member consent.
Use of the website indicates acceptance of this Agreement by users, visitors, and members.

sellerAgreement.title: Seller Membership and Partnership Agreement
sellerAgreement.introduction: This Seller Membership and Partnership Agreement is executed between E.C.T.S TRADING LTD platform and individuals or legal entities wishing to operate as sellers. By approving this agreement, you accept all terms and conditions.
sellerAgreement.footerNote: By continuing to use our platform, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agreed to this Seller Membership and Partnership Agreement.

parties.title: Parties and General Provisions
content: This agreement is executed between E.C.T.S TRADING LTD and the Seller, regulating the rights and obligations regarding virtual store opening and product sales on the e-commerce platform.
The Seller must be an individual over 18 years of age or an authorized representative of a legal entity.
The annexes to the agreement and all documents presented on the website are integral parts of the agreement.
E.C.T.S reserves the right to evaluate seller applications and reject them without stating a reason.

definitions.title: Definitions
content: Buyer: Refers to the individual or legal entity member who purchases the seller's products through the platform.
Service: Refers to all services provided by E.C.T.S for sellers to publish, offer for sale, and market their products on the platform.
Virtual Store: Refers to the virtual space allocated to sellers where they can display their products.
Platform/Website: Refers to all internet sites, mobile applications, and mobile sites owned by E.C.T.S where services are provided.
Cargo Company: Refers to E.C.T.S itself and/or contracted cargo company that ensures product delivery to buyers.

purpose.title: Purpose and Scope of the Agreement
content: E.C.T.S operates an e-commerce platform and is an intermediary service provider that brings sellers and buyers together.
Under the agreement, the Seller can become a member of the platform, open a virtual store, and sell products.
E.C.T.S is not the seller of products on the platform; it only provides intermediary services.
The relationship between the Seller and buyers is not covered by this agreement; the seller is personally responsible for all obligations.

sellerObligations.title: Seller's Rights and Obligations
content: The Seller shall provide all documents specified in ANNEX-1 completely during application.
The Seller shall fill out the membership form completely and accurately and be responsible for incorrect information.
The Seller is fully responsible for password security; all transactions made with their password belong to them.
The Seller is obliged to notify the platform of all information and document changes within 15 days.
The Seller commits to delivering products to buyers completely, without defects, and in compliance with legislation.
The Seller is personally responsible for the accuracy and legality of all announcements and content published on the platform.
The Seller shall only communicate with buyers and enter into contracts through the platform.
The Seller shall not offer prohibited products listed in ANNEX-2 for sale.
The Seller shall not engage in activities that violate platform campaigns and discounts.

platformRights.title: Platform Rights and Authorities
content: E.C.T.S has the right to make any changes for the platform to function properly.
E.C.T.S reserves the right to reject seller applications without stating a reason and request additional documents.
E.C.T.S can temporarily or permanently suspend listings that violate agreement terms and terminate membership.
E.C.T.S reserves the right to change service commission rates and payment terms.
E.C.T.S does not guarantee uninterrupted platform operation except in cases of force majeure.
E.C.T.S has the right to control content and block access.
E.C.T.S can offset damages incurred from the seller's current account.

salesConditions.title: Sales and Listing Conditions
content: The Seller commits that the sale and display of their products comply with current legislation.
The Seller shall not display or sell counterfeit/fake products.
The Seller shall conduct all activities without causing technical damage to the platform.
The Seller accepts being the seller party in distance sales contracts made with buyers.
The Seller is responsible for product quality, warranty certificate issuance, and after-sales services.
The Seller is obliged to list products in the correct category and not publish misleading information.
The Seller cannot use E.C.T.S's intellectual property rights without permission.
The Seller shall fulfill return processes within the scope of withdrawal rights in accordance with legislation.

financial.title: Financial Matters
content: The Seller earns the right to receive the sales price on condition of fully fulfilling their obligations.
Commission rates, payment terms, and financial conditions are applied as specified in ANNEX-3.
The Seller is required to issue an invoice or retail sales receipt for sold products.
Payment is made on the specified due date after product delivery and buyer approval.
Cargo costs are covered by the seller and invoiced by E.C.T.S.
Penalty clauses apply in case of delay or defective delivery.
The Seller is obliged to fulfill return requests within the scope of withdrawal rights within 7 days.
Bank and payment institution commissions belong to the seller.

termination.title: Term and Termination of the Agreement
content: The agreement enters into force upon electronic approval by the seller and is indefinite.
Parties can terminate the agreement by giving 1 month written notice.
E.C.T.S can immediately terminate the agreement in case of violation of agreement terms.
The agreement automatically terminates in cases of bankruptcy, liquidation, or insolvency.
The seller's responsibilities to buyers continue in case of agreement termination.
E.C.T.S has the right to temporarily suspend and pause services.
The Seller is obliged to compensate all damages arising from breach of agreement.

confidentiality.title: Confidentiality and Personal Data Protection
content: Commercial, financial, and technical information of the parties is considered confidential.
The confidentiality obligation continues for 3 years after the agreement ends.
The Seller shall process personal data in accordance with current legislation.
The Seller shall take all necessary technical and administrative measures to protect personal data.
E.C.T.S will store seller information in a secure environment and may use it for specified purposes.
Parties may provide information to their advisors in mandatory cases but are responsible for confidentiality obligations.

disputeResolution.title: Dispute Resolution and Other Provisions
content: The agreement is exclusively subject to TRNC laws.
Disputes are under the jurisdiction of TRNC courts.
E.C.T.S's records constitute binding and conclusive evidence.
The agreement does not establish agency or partnership relations between parties.
The Seller cannot transfer rights arising from the agreement without E.C.T.S's written permission.
Parties are not held responsible in cases of force majeure.
Agreement changes can be made unilaterally by E.C.T.S and enter into force on the publication date.
Notifications will be made to the registered email address or physical address.

productPreview.pageDescription: Review all details before submitting for approval

deliveryDescriptions.fast: Fast and reliable delivery to your customers

importantNotice.title: Important Notice
importantNotice.description: Your product will be reviewed by our team before being published. This process usually takes 24-48 hours. You will be notified when your product is approved and goes live on the platform.

errors.dataPreparationFailed: Error occurred while preparing data. Please try again.
errors.compressionFailed: Image compression failed. Please try again.

footwearSizeStep.title: Select Size
footwearSizeStep.pleaseSelectAtLeastOneSize: Please select at least one size

colorOptionStep.title: Color Options
colorOptionStep.colorOptionWarning: Please add image and quantity for all selected colors

cancelAndReturnPolicy.title: Cancellation and Return Policy
cancelAndReturnPolicy.introduction: This page provides detailed information about the cancellation and return conditions applicable to your online shopping transactions. You can find all information about your consumer rights and processes here.
cancelAndReturnPolicy.footerNote: These terms have been prepared in accordance with applicable legislation. If you have any questions, you can contact our customer service.

general.title: General Terms
content: By placing an order electronically through the website, you are deemed to have accepted the preliminary information form and distance selling contract presented to you.
Buyers are subject to consumer protection laws in force regarding the sale and delivery of the products they purchase.
Product shipping costs (cargo fees) will be paid by the buyers.
Each purchased product is delivered to the specified address within the legal period not exceeding 30 days.
The purchased product is delivered complete and in accordance with the specifications stated in the order.
If it becomes impossible to sell the purchased product, the seller must notify in writing within 3 days of learning this situation and refund the total amount within 14 days.

rightOfWithdrawal.title: Right of Withdrawal
content: The buyer can exercise the right of withdrawal within 7 days from the delivery date of the product without giving any reason.
Withdrawal notification must be made in writing through the designated contact information.
For service contracts, the right of withdrawal can be exercised within 7 days from the date of signing the contract.
The right of withdrawal cannot be exercised for services that have started with the consumer's consent.
Costs arising from the use of the right of withdrawal belong to the seller.

withdrawalProcess.title: Withdrawal Process
content: To exercise the right of withdrawal, written notification must be made by registered mail or email within 7 days.
The invoice of the product to be returned must be sent completely.
For corporate invoices, it must be sent together with the return invoice issued by the corporation.
The return form and the product's box, packaging, and standard accessories must be delivered complete and undamaged.
The product must not have been used within the conditions specified in this contract.

returnConditions.title: Return Conditions
content: The seller must refund the total amount within 20 days at the latest after receiving the withdrawal notification.
The seller is also obligated to collect the goods within the same period.
In case of value decrease due to the buyer's fault, the buyer compensates the seller's damages.
The buyer is not responsible for changes resulting from proper use within the withdrawal period.
If the campaign discount amount threshold is not met, the discount amount is cancelled.

nonReturnableItems.title: Non-Returnable Items
content: Products prepared according to personal needs and not suitable for return
Underwear, swimwear and bikini bottoms
Makeup products and single-use items
Goods with risk of quick spoilage or expiration date
Products that are not suitable for health and hygiene if packaging is opened
Products that mix with other products after delivery and cannot be separated
Periodical publications like newspapers and magazines
Services performed instantly in electronic environment
Audio/video recordings, books, digital content, software programs
Computer consumables with opened packaging

damagedProducts.title: Damaged or Defective Products
content: When receiving your order, pay attention that the packages are complete and intact.
The cargo officer will get your signature confirming complete delivery.
If there is damage outside the package, do not accept the products and have the cargo officer prepare a report.
Exchange of damaged products is carried out within 7 business days.
In this case, no additional shipping or product fee will be requested from you.
If there are missing products, accept the other products and note the missing ones.
In case of wrong product, do not accept this product and indicate it on the delivery receipt.

refundPolicy.title: Refund Policy
content: For cash payment order cancellations, cash payment is made within 20 days from the cancellation date.
For credit card payments, refund is made to the bank account within 20 days from the cancellation date.
Bank transfer to customer account may take 2-3 weeks.
No refund is made for returns of used, worn and washed products.
In this case, the product is sent back to the customer.
Returns are not accepted for furniture after assembly.
Returns are not accepted for white goods in case of unauthorized opening.

paymentIssues.title: Payment Issues
content: If the buyer does not make payment, the seller's delivery obligation ends.
If unauthorized use of credit card is detected, the buyer must return the product within 3 days.
In this case, shipping cost belongs to the seller.
In case of default, the cardholder pays interest within the framework of the contract with the bank.
The bank may resort to legal remedies and request costs from the buyer.
In case of delay, the buyer pays the damage and loss suffered by the seller.

deliveryIssues.title: Delivery Issues
content: Delivery delays may occur due to unforeseeable force majeure events.
In this case, the buyer is immediately informed.
The buyer can request order cancellation, exchange with a similar product, or postponement of delivery.
In case of cancellation, cash payments are refunded within 20 days.
Credit card payments are refunded to the bank within 20 days.
The buyer should inspect the product before delivery and should not accept damaged products.
The delivered product is accepted as undamaged and the buyer must protect it carefully.

distanceSellingContract.title: Distance Selling Contract
distanceSellingContract.introduction: This Distance Selling Contract has been prepared in accordance with the Consumer Protection Law No. 40/2003 - 55/2020. By accepting this contract, the BUYER acknowledges that they have been informed about all terms and conditions regarding the ordered products and agrees to fulfill all payment obligations.
distanceSellingContract.footerNote: By accepting this contract, you agree to all terms and conditions stated above. For any questions or concerns, please contact our customer service team.

parties.title: Parties
content: This contract has been signed between the following parties under the terms and conditions specified below.
SELLER: Company name, address, telephone, and email information will be provided at the time of purchase.
BUYER: The person placing the order, whose details (name, address, telephone, email) will be collected during the checkout process.

By accepting this contract, the BUYER acknowledges that upon confirming the order, they undertake the obligation to pay the order amount and additional charges such as shipping fees and taxes, if any, and accepts that they have been informed in advance about this matter.

subject.title: Subject of the Contract
content: The subject of this contract is the determination of the rights and obligations of the parties regarding the product whose features and sales price are specified in Article 3 of this contract.
This contract has been prepared in accordance with the provisions of the Consumer Protection Law No. 40/2003 - 55/2020.
The parties to this contract acknowledge and declare that they know and understand the obligations and responsibilities arising from the Consumer Protection Law with this contract.
This contract is aimed at the BUYER's acquisition of the product(s) specified in this contract.

productInfo.title: Product Information
content: The type, quantity, brand, model, color, number, sales price, delivery/invoice address, delivery person, and payment method of the product are as specified at the time of order.
All product specifications will be clearly displayed during the checkout process.
The sales price includes VAT and all other expenses.
Payment methods available: Credit card, bank transfer/EFT, cash on delivery (where applicable).
Delivery and invoice addresses will be collected during the order process.

generalProvisions.title: General Provisions
content: The parties to this contract are the BUYER and the SELLER, and all obligations and responsibilities related to the fulfillment of this contract belong to the parties. This contract comes into force on the date it is electronically approved by the BUYER.

The BUYER accepts, declares, and undertakes that they have read and understood all information regarding the features of the product specified in Article 3 and the conditions related to the sale, and that they have given the necessary approval for the purchase of this product.

The SELLER is responsible for delivering the product subject to the contract in sound, complete condition, in accordance with the qualities specified in the order, and together with warranty documents and user manuals, if any, to the cargo.

If the product subject to the contract is to be delivered to a person/organization other than the BUYER, the SELLER cannot be held responsible if the person/organization to be delivered refuses to accept the delivery.

Delivery will be made by hand via the cargo company at the address specified in Article 3 of the BUYER. Even if the buyer is not at the address at the time of delivery, the SELLER will be deemed to have fulfilled its obligation fully and completely.
If the product price is not paid for any reason or is canceled in bank records, the SELLER is deemed to be released from the obligation to deliver the product.

In the situation described in 4.6, the BUYER is responsible for any expenses and other losses arising from the late receipt of the product by the BUYER, or the product having waited at the cargo company and/or the cargo being returned to the SELLER.
Shipping fee is added to the order total and paid by the BUYER. Shipping fee is not included in the product price.

If the credit card belonging to the BUYER is used illegally or unlawfully by unauthorized persons in a manner not caused by the fault of the BUYER after the delivery of the product, and the relevant bank or financial institution does not pay the product price to the SELLER, the BUYER is obliged to return the product to the SELLER within 3 (three) days, provided that it has been delivered to them. In this case, transportation costs will be borne by the BUYER.

For products sold with or without a warranty certificate, defective or faulty (defective) products can be sent to the SELLER to have the necessary repairs carried out by the authorized service under warranty conditions; in this case, cargo costs will be covered by the SELLER.

The BUYER acknowledges that they know that since installment sales are only made with credit cards belonging to banks, they need to separately confirm the relevant interest rates and information about default interest from their bank.

The BUYER accepts, declares, and undertakes that the provisions regarding interest and default interest will be applied within the scope of the credit card agreement between the bank and the BUYER in accordance with the provisions of the current legislation.

In cases where the BUYER exercises the right of withdrawal, or when the product subject to the order cannot be supplied for various reasons, or in cases where the Consumer Council and the Goods and Services Arbitration Committee decide to refund the amount to the Consumer, if the purchase was made with a credit card and in installments, the credit card refund procedure is specified below.

For purchases made with a credit card and when the product is paid in installments, the BUYER's bank also makes the refund to the consumer in the same number of installments as the BUYER purchased the product. After the SELLER pays the full product price to the bank in one payment, in case of refund of installment purchases made from bank POS systems to the BUYER's credit card, the requested refund amounts will be transferred to the cardholder's accounts by the bank in installments to prevent the parties involved from being victimized.

In case of return of goods and services purchased with a card, the SELLER cannot make payment to the BUYER in cash due to a separate contract made with the bank. Since the SELLER is obliged to pay the relevant amount to the bank in cash or by offset in case of a refund, as per the procedure, they will not make cash payment to the BUYER. In case of refunds to credit cards, the refund will be made to the card by the bank after the SELLER pays the price to the bank in one payment.

For cash on delivery and bank transfer/EFT payment options, the refund will be made by requesting bank account information from the Consumer and transferring it to the account specified by the consumer (the account must be in the name of the person at the billing address or in the name of the member user) by transfer or EFT.

In accordance with the Tax Procedure Law No. 27/1977 and the communiqués and regulations issued under this law, and Chapter 267 Commodity Sales and Chapter 149 Contracts Law, in order to carry out refund transactions, the relevant refund sections on the invoice must be filled in completely and signed and then sent back to the SELLER together with the product. The BUYER declares, accepts, and undertakes that they accept all this procedure.

The SELLER will not share any personal information communicated to them by the BUYER with third parties for purposes other than those disclosed regarding the collection of information and the SELLER's activities related to this contract and the provision of qualified electronic certificates, and will not sell or disclose such personal information to third parties, and will not allow its use under any circumstances. Information provided by the BUYER may be used by the BUYER, their partners, and persons or institutions in cooperation with them to make various statistical evaluations, create databases, and/or conduct market research without disclosing the identity of the member, and to provide information about products and services if permission is obtained from the BUYER. Personal information is understood as name and surname, address, telephone number, email address, and all other information aimed at identifying the BUYER. The SELLER undertakes to keep personal information strictly confidential, to consider itself under the obligation of confidentiality in this matter, and to take all necessary measures to prevent unauthorized use of all or any part of confidential information or disclosure to a third party, except for the exceptions determined by this contract, for the purpose of ensuring and maintaining confidentiality, and to show the necessary diligence in this direction.

rightOfWithdrawal.title: Right of Withdrawal
content: The BUYER has the right to withdraw from the contract by rejecting the goods or services within seven days from the date they received the goods related to this contract and from the date this contract was established for the services subject to the contract, without assuming any legal or criminal liability and without giving any reason.

The BUYER will communicate their declaration that they wish to exercise the right of withdrawal within the valid period to the SELLER with the sample right of withdrawal form included in the annex to this contract or by any of the communication methods specified in this contract.
The product price will be refunded to the BUYER within 20 days from the date the consumer's withdrawal notice reaches the seller.

To exercise the right of withdrawal, notification must be made to the SELLER by fax, email, or telephone with the withdrawal form included in the annex within this period, and the product must not have been used within the framework of Article 6 provisions.

In case of exercising this right, it is mandatory to return the original invoice along with a copy of the cargo delivery receipt showing that the product delivered to the third party or the BUYER has been sent to the SELLER.

The product price will be refunded to the BUYER within 20 days following the receipt of these documents. If the original invoice is not sent, VAT and other legal obligations, if any, cannot be refunded.
The shipping cost of the product returned due to the right of withdrawal is covered by the SELLER.

nonWithdrawableProducts.title: Products for Which the Right of Withdrawal Cannot Be Exercised
content: The right of withdrawal cannot be exercised for products that cannot be returned due to their nature, single-use products, copyable software and programs, products that spoil quickly, or products whose expiration date has passed.
For the following products, exercising the right of withdrawal is subject to the condition that the product's packaging is unopened, undamaged, and the product has not been used:
- Portable computers (will not be accepted for return after the original operating system is installed)
- All types of software and programs
- DVDs, VCDs, CDs, and cassettes
- Computer and stationery consumables (toner, cartridge, ribbon, etc.)
- All types of cosmetic products
- Telephone top-up orders

The product subject to the contract is an electronic signature creation tool and card reader, and the qualified electronic certificate is within the scope of goods produced in accordance with the BUYER's special requests and demands or with changes or additions made to it to make it personal.
When there are goods prepared according to the BUYER's requests or personal needs, they cannot exercise the right of withdrawal or avoid paying the product or goods price.

defaultProvisions.title: Default Provisions
content: In case the parties fail to fulfill their obligations arising from this contract, the rules of Default of the Debtor contained in Chapter 149 will be applied.

In case of default, if either party fails to fulfill its obligations within the period without a justified reason, the other party will give the party that has not fulfilled its obligation a period of 14 days to fulfill the said obligation.

If it is not fulfilled within this period, the right to demand the fulfillment of the obligation from the party that has not fulfilled its obligation will arise, including the delivery of the goods and/or termination of the contract and/or refund of the price and/or if it is an installment payment, all the price will become due and the right to demand the entire price will arise.

If the SELLER cannot deliver the product subject to the contract within the period due to force majeure that may prevent the SELLER from fulfilling this obligation or extraordinary events such as weather opposition that prevents transportation, interruption of transportation, fire, earthquake, flood, the BUYER may use one of the rights to cancel the order or postpone the delivery period until the preventive situation is eliminated, acknowledging that the SELLER has no responsibility in such situations.
In case the BUYER cancels the order, the amount paid will be paid to them within 10 (ten) days.

jurisdiction.title: Jurisdiction
content: TRNC Courts are authorized for disputes arising from this contract.
This contract has been prepared on the date specified at the time of order acceptance.

withdrawalForm.title: Withdrawal Form (Annex-1)
withdrawalForm.description: For exercising your right of withdrawal, you can use the withdrawal form by contacting our customer service or downloading it from our website. The form should include: Order date or delivery date, goods or services subject to withdrawal, price, buyer's name and surname, ID/passport number, telephone, address, and signature (if sent on paper).

personalDataProtection.title: Personal Data Protection Policy
personalDataProtection.introductionText: ECTS TRADING LTD ("Company") prioritizes the privacy and security of your personal data. We process your personal information in compliance with Law No. 89/2007 on the Protection of Personal Data and all relevant legislation. This policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your personal information.
personalDataProtection.footerNote: For questions about your personal data or to exercise your rights, please contact us using the methods specified in the Contact section.

introduction.title: Introduction
content: As ECTS TRADING LTD ("Company"), the confidentiality and security of your personal data are among our top priorities.

The Company processes your personal data in compliance with the Personal Data Protection Law No. 89/2007, the Regulation on Procedures and Principles to be Followed in Fulfilling the Obligation to Inform issued under Article 28 of the Personal Data Protection Law, and all relevant legal legislation.
Personal data means any information that makes your identity specific or identifiable.

We would like to inform you about your personal data processed when you become a "Platform Member" by accepting the Membership Agreement in order to benefit from the services offered on our mobile applications and/or websites (collectively "Platform") owned by our Company (collectively "Platform Services").

dataCollected.title: What Personal Data Do We Process?
content: If you become a Platform Member, the following personal data is processed:

User Account Information: Your name, surname, customer number, membership email address, and if you add to your user information: phone number, gender, date of birth, height and weight information, ID Number (processed only in accordance with relevant legislation if you purchase certain product groups).

Customer Transaction Information: Your order and invoice information, transaction history information related to your purchases, your request and complaint information, Platform usage information, information you personally share in your comments and questions if you comment and/or ask questions about products on the Platform, your score and evaluation information, information about chat channel conversation content, your cancellation/return information.
Delivery Information: Phone number and delivery address information you add for the delivery of the product you ordered, delivery transaction information.
Payment Information: Information about payments made by you and payment methods, saved card information.
Transaction Security Information: Your device information, IP address information, password and passcode information, cookie information, platform access records, login method (via Google/Facebook).

Legal Process Information: Information in correspondence with authorized persons, institutions and organizations, information in files before courts and other arbitration boards, legal information request information.
Audio Recording Information: Your voice recording if you contact the call center.

Personal data processed within the scope of additional services: Data processed if you benefit from additional services such as food, market, financial services, insurance, lucky draw, buy-sell-earn (Dolap) offered on the Platform.

processingPurposes.title: Legal Grounds, Purposes and Collection Methods
content: Your personal data is collected by our Company in whole or in part through automated or non-automated means, provided that it is part of a data recording system, electronically through the mobile application or websites where the Platform Service you benefit from within the scope of our membership agreement is located.

Membership and Account Creation: To establish and perform the membership agreement, create and manage your Platform member profile/account, verify contact information, conduct purchase transactions through the Platform, ensure Platform operations security, and comply with legal obligations including Consumer Protection Law, Goods and Services Law, and Tax Procedure Law.

Order, Delivery and Cancellation/Return Processes: To place and create orders, establish and perform distance sales contracts, conduct delivery and logistics activities, manage cancellation/return processes, conduct payment and invoicing processes, and fulfill legal obligations.

Customer Experience Improvement: To provide quick and easy access to products suitable for your preferences and interests, provide better user experience across Platform Services, improve and enhance user experience and service quality, conduct analysis and reporting, manage communication activities, evaluate requests, complaints and suggestions, and provide after-sales support services.

Company Information Security, Risk, Audit and Control: To conduct and audit finance and accounting processes, conduct invoicing processes, manage information security processes and investigate suspicious transactions, ensure Platform operations security, control and improve product and service quality, conduct risk analysis, manage complaints, prevent fraud, and conduct legal and financial due diligence in potential corporate mergers, acquisitions, joint ventures, divisions and other structural changes.

Legal Proceedings: To conduct legal and litigation affairs, respond to legal requests, review and respond to your applications as data subjects in accordance with procedures, conduct legal compliance activities, fulfill obligations arising from legislation, conduct legal consultancy processes, share information with authorized persons, institutions and organizations when requested, and establish, exercise or protect a right in case of legal dispute.

Consent-Based Processes: To conduct marketing, advertising and promotional activities, conduct financial offer processes, offer special advantageous offers to you, and conduct activities to increase your satisfaction by getting to know you better, including sending commercial electronic messages.

dataSharing.title: With Whom and Why Do We Share Your Personal Data?
content: Our Company takes care to process your personal data in accordance with the principles of 'need to know' and 'need to use', ensuring necessary data minimization and taking necessary technical and administrative security measures.

Your personal data is shared with the recipient groups detailed below based on the legal grounds of 'being necessary to fulfill our Company's legal obligations', 'being necessary for the establishment or performance of a contract', 'being necessary for the establishment, exercise or protection of a right', and/or 'being necessary for our Company's legitimate interests'.

For membership and account creation: With our subsidiaries and group companies for providing Platform Services, establishing and performing membership agreement; with our IT infrastructure providers, operators or service providers, our subsidiaries, group companies, business partners and service providers for conducting Platform operations, receiving information technology and software services.

For order, delivery and cancellation/return: With the seller or service provider of the product you want to purchase for providing Platform Services, conducting purchase and invoicing processes, fulfilling obligations arising from legislation; with product sellers, cargo companies, special couriers for conducting logistics activities and tracking delivery processes; with contracted banks and other payment institutions for conducting and tracking payment processes.

For customer experience improvement: With our business partners providing call center services and customer support service providers for providing sales and after-sales support services, ensuring customer satisfaction, meeting requests and complaints; with service providers, IT infrastructure, software and technology service providers located abroad for conducting activities to improve and enhance products and services offered by our Company.

For information security, risk, audit and control: With business partners, consultants and service providers, banks, e-invoice partners, cargo and courier companies, independent audit, customs, financial advisor/accounting service providers for conducting invoicing processes, sending e-invoices electronically to customers, delivering physical contracts or invoices, managing financial and accounting processes, identifying and evaluating risks, preventing fraud.

For legal proceedings: With regulatory and supervisory institutions and authorized public institutions and organizations such as courts and arbitrators for fulfilling obligations arising from legislation, conducting Platform activities in accordance with legislation, providing information to authorized persons, institutions and organizations, tracking and conducting legal affairs, exercising and protecting a right in case of legal dispute; with lawyers, auditors, tax consultants, forensic IT experts, cybersecurity consultants, group companies, subsidiaries, other third parties and business partners from whom we receive consultancy and services.

dataProtection.title: How Does the Company Protect Your Personal Data?
content: Personal data shared with our Company is under the supervision and control of the Company. The Company has assumed responsibility as a data controller to establish the necessary organization and take and adapt technical measures to protect the confidentiality and integrity of information in accordance with current relevant legislation provisions.
Being aware of our obligation in this regard:
Penetration tests are conducted at periodic intervals in accordance with international and national technical standards on data confidentiality.
Personal data you transmit to the Company through the website, mobile site and mobile application is protected using SSL (Secure Sockets Layer) technology.
Risk analyses are regularly conducted regarding personal data processing activities and actions are taken to reduce risks.
Access and authorization controls are applied to prevent unauthorized access to personal data.
Data processing policies are regularly updated.

yourRights.title: Your Rights Regarding Protection of Personal Data
content: By contacting our Company through the methods specified in the 'Contact for Your Rights and Requests' section of this disclosure text, you have the right to:
Learn whether your personal data is being processed. The controller must respond to you in writing.
Request correction, deletion or blocking of data, especially due to errors and deficiencies not processed in accordance with the rules of this Law.

Request notification to third parties to whom the data has been transmitted about any correction, deletion and blocking made in accordance with the law, unless impossible or requiring disproportionate effort.

If the controller does not respond within thirty days from the submission of the application or if the response is not satisfactory, you have the right to apply to the Board. The Board makes the decision on this matter.
You can exercise your right of access with the help of an expert.

The controller, by decision of the Board, may limit, postpone or refuse to provide information to you if it is clearly stipulated in special law, necessary for a superior public interest especially for protecting the internal and external security of the State, or if providing information would make it difficult to achieve the purpose of an administrative or criminal investigation, and will notify you in writing of the reason.

If the controller does not respond within the time period granted, or if you do not find the response satisfactory, you have the right to apply to the Board and request review of your objections. The Board makes the decision on this matter. The President may issue an instruction to immediately suspend processing until a final decision is made on the objections if there is a high risk of harm to you and your objections are found reasonable and if processing continues.

contact.title: Contact for Your Rights and Requests
content: You can submit your questions and requests regarding your personal data with a petition prepared in accordance with the conditions specified in the Communiqué on Procedures and Principles for Application to the Data Controller or with the 'ECTS TRADING LTD Application Form' using the following methods:

Application Method: In-person written application, Registered Electronic Mail (KEP) signed with Secure Electronic Signature or Mobile Signature, from your email address previously notified to our Company and registered in the system.
Please write 'Personal Data Protection Law Related Data Subject Request' on the delivery envelope or in the subject line of the email.

Data subjects who will apply through 'In-person Written Application' are required to present identity verification documents. In this context, please submit only the front side of your ID card photocopy (without showing blood type and religion section) along with the application form for in-person written applications you will make to the address.

As personal data owners, if you submit your requests regarding your rights to the Company, the Company will finalize your request free of charge within 30 (thirty) days at the latest. However, if the response to your application requires a cost in accordance with the legislation, the fee in the tariff determined by the Personal Data Protection Board may be requested by the Company.

updates.title: About the Disclosure Text
content: The Company reserves the right to update this Personal Data Protection Disclosure Text at any time within the framework of changes that may be made in the current legislation.

RefundForm.title: Refund Request
RefundForm.headerSubtitle: Fill out the form below to submit your refund request
RefundForm.descriptionPlaceholder: Please describe the reason for your refund request in detail...
RefundForm.descriptionTooShort: Description must be at least 20 characters
RefundForm.submitSuccess: Your refund request has been submitted successfully. We will review it and get back to you soon.
RefundForm.submitError: An error occurred while submitting your refund request. Please try again.
RefundForm.infoMessage: Our team will review your refund request within 2-3 business days. You will receive an email notification regarding the status of your request.

ShippingInfo.title: Track Shipment
ShippingInfo.headerSubtitle: Enter your shipment code to track your order status
ShippingInfo.codeHelper: Enter the code you received via SMS after payment
ShippingInfo.codeTooShort: Shipment code must be at least 6 characters
ShippingInfo.fetchError: Unable to retrieve shipment information. Please try again.
ShippingInfo.infoMessage: Your package will be delivered soon. You will receive notifications for status updates.

at-shop.title: Package at Shop
at-shop.description: Your order is ready and waiting at the shop for collection by our courier

collected.title: Collected from Shop
collected.description: Your package has been collected from the shop and is being prepared for delivery

in-transit.title: In Transit
in-transit.description: Your package is on its way to the delivery hub

out-for-delivery.title: Out for Delivery
out-for-delivery.description: Your package is with our courier and will be delivered today

delivered.title: Delivered
delivered.description: Your package has been successfully delivered. Thank you for shopping with us!
